e3763567-430a-444f-a95e-38e12fde2b85.description: The Certified Nonprofit Professional or CNP is the only national nonprofit management credential in the U.S. Earners of this credential have successfully completed a rigorous leadership development program that includes assessed coursework and applied learning opportunities, such as internships, consulting projects, and service-learning activities. Research shows that CNPs have the critical skills and networks necessary for successful leadership in the nonprofit sector.
e3763567-430a-444f-a95e-38e12fde2b85.name: Certified Nonprofit Professional (CNP)

badge_template_activities.title: Complete extensive, assessed coursework grounded in the 10 core competencies necessary for effective nonprofit leadership

Many nonprofit jobs require secondary educational experience to ensure employees are prepared for the workforce and have basic knowledge. We recognize that education is important but value education and experience. Meet this requirement through a completed college degree, college credit, military service, certificate specialty (e.g. CFRE or CAE), or professional life experience.

Build on your professional nonprofit experience to develop knowledge and skills to make a powerful impact in the social sector. This requirement can be met through one year or more of professional experience or a combination of experiences (such as internships, service years, and summer jobs).

We work in an ever-changing sector. Staying up to date on current events and trends, continually building your professional network, and listening to nonprofit leaders from across the county is important to lifelong learning. To meet this requirement, attend a national nonprofit conference.

Volunteerism is a key component for most nonprofit organizations. The requirement encourages CNP participants to understand the value of volunteerism. To meet this requirement, contribute your time and talent through 20+ hours of volunteer service within the last two years or during the program. You may volunteer with any nonprofit organization in person or online.

1bb1cb3a-a5e8-4376-a690-b24ad3bfe52f.description: Earners of the Equity Journey e-certificate have enhanced their personal awareness and skills related to diversity, equity, and inclusion. They have developed a deeper understanding of how advancing equity can increase the effectiveness of social-impact organizations and have gained awareness of the structural and systemic barriers that hinder equity. They are equipped with the knowledge and tools to continue advancing equity at the personal, organizational, and community levels.
1bb1cb3a-a5e8-4376-a690-b24ad3bfe52f.name: Phi Delta Epsilon Equity Journey E-Certificate

badge_template_activities.title: Participated in intensive self-paced training that provided skills and resources to advance equity work.  Required activities included: cultural competency benchmarking surveys, personal assessments, and reflection activities.
Created personal and organizational equity action plans.

7561cec7-f05a-4288-b8f5-09cd85e49828.description: Earners of this e-Certificate have enhanced their personal understanding and skills for building cultural competency and critical thinking around nonprofit advocacy, equity, innovations, and leadership. They have developed a deeper awareness of how the nonprofit sector is rapidly evolving to tackle society’s most pressing issues and how they can lead these efforts!
7561cec7-f05a-4288-b8f5-09cd85e49828.name: Social Sector Leadership

badge_template_activities.title: Participated in a three-day virtual conference that provided training and resources on nonprofit advocacy, equity, innovations, and leadership. Required activities included: attending four keynote sessions, watching a minimum of six on-demand sessions, and actively engaging in at least three professional development activities.

f8388dff-e01e-46cd-bcba-f88694c49a62.description: Earners of this e-Certificate have enhanced their personal understanding and skills for building cultural competency and critical thinking around nonprofit workforce trends and leadership. They have developed a deeper understanding of how to manage change in times of uncertainly.
f8388dff-e01e-46cd-bcba-f88694c49a62.name: Workforce Trends and Leadership e-Certificate

badge_template_activities.title: Participated in a three-day virtual conference that provided skills and resources on nonprofit workforce trends and leadership. Required activities included: attending four keynote sessions, watching a minimum of four on-demand sessions, and actively engaging in at least three professional development activities.

c0310cc1-c037-4abe-b9a7-cab70af9b011.description: Earners of this e-Certificate have enhanced their personal understanding and skills for building cultural competency and critical thinking around nonprofit advocacy, equity, innovations and leadership. They developed a deeper understanding of the nonprofit sector's evolution since the start of the pandemic and acknowledge that the sector's past "normal" is not good enough. Earners of this badge are well equipped to be the changemakers that our world needs.
c0310cc1-c037-4abe-b9a7-cab70af9b011.name: Social Sector Leadership

badge_template_activities.title: Participated in a three-day virtual conference that provided training and resources on nonprofit advocacy, equity, innovations and leadership. Required activities included: attending three keynote sessions, watching a minimum of six on-demand sessions and actively engaging in at least three professional development activities.

447774a0-c1d7-428f-8dee-47ccb1af10ff.description: Earners of this digital badge enhanced their personal understanding and skills for building critical thinking around nonprofit advocacy, equity, innovations, fundraising, and leadership. They developed a deeper comprehension of the nonprofit sector's trends and how to plan for the future. Earners of this badge are well-equipped to be the changemakers that our world needs.
447774a0-c1d7-428f-8dee-47ccb1af10ff.name: Social Sector Leadership ELEVATE 2023

badge_template_activities.title: Participated in a three-day virtual conference that provided training and resources on nonprofit advocacy, equity, innovations, fundraising, and leadership. Required activities included: attending two keynote sessions, at least two expert panels, four breakout sessions, and two workshops.

a16c4cd6-7f77-4b91-a504-5384fd6b3c9b.description: Earners of the Foundations of Nonprofit Management e-Certificate understand the history, contributions, and unique characteristics of the nonprofit sector and its management. They have demonstrated competency through assessed coursework and applied learning such as internships, consulting projects and service-learning activities.

Created equity action plan or organizational equity audit.

6975a376-83e9-4de7-819d-0eb8ef6fbb18.description: Earners of the Workforce Trends and Equity e-Certificate have enhanced their personal awareness and skills related to workforce trends and their implementation in the nonprofit sector. 6975a376-83e9-4de7-819d-0eb8ef6fbb18.name: Workforce Trends and Equity e-Certificate

badge_template_activities.title: Participated in a three-day intensive training that provided skills and resources to advance equity work. Created a personal or organization-based equity action plan.

aea3c48b-0ae2-468f-887a-440a3a735611.description: Earners of the Nonprofit Governance and Volunteer Management e-Certificate have critical knowledge about the roles and responsibilities of nonprofit boards and volunteers. 1939a871-bd2c-41c8-a0c1-89f481c9b651.description: Earners of the Effective Staff Supervision in Nonprofit Organizations e-Certificate understand both tactical and strategic issues related to effective supervision, including: hiring, monitoring, feedback strategies, legal framework including risk mitigation, personal and structural bias, creating productive teams with diverse strengths, skills and backgrounds. They have demonstrated competency through assessed coursework and applied learning.
1939a871-bd2c-41c8-a0c1-89f481c9b651.name: Effective Staff Supervision in Nonprofits e-Certificate

416fd2f1-5f67-41c9-81da-82169cbd4832.description: Earners of the Self-Aware Leader e-Certificate have enhanced their personal awareness of their values and leadership ideals, They have deepened their understanding of the leader's role with a focus on empathy and authenticity with the goal of aligning values, expectations, and behaviors.
416fd2f1-5f67-41c9-81da-82169cbd4832.name: Independent Sector: Self Aware Leader E-Certificate

badge_template_activities.title: Participated in intensive self-paced training that provided skills and resources to advance personal leadership skills;  Required activities included: readings, personal assessments, discussion assignments and reflection exercises
Created a personal brand statement
Completed a self-reflection workbook.

349c703b-2beb-4839-9cac-ae7679ebd6a5.description: The Advanced Certified Nonprofit Professional (ACNP) credential recognizes experience and knowledge about the successful management and leadership of nonprofit sector organizations, ongoing professional development to both center and expand your thinking, and a commitment to volunteer service. The credential must be renewed every three years.
349c703b-2beb-4839-9cac-ae7679ebd6a5.name: Advanced Certified Nonprofit Professional (ACNP)

badge_template_activities.title: Certified Nonprofit Professional (CNP)

Professional Development requirement- Candidates must complete 75 hours or more of professional development activity related to the CNP competencies. Activities must be completed within the last five years. Renewal of the ACNP is required every three years. When renewing the credential, the candidate will be required to have completed 45 hours over that three-year time period.
Candidates must have held or currently hold a nonprofit management position and have 5 or more years of professional work with a nonprofit organization.

Candidates must complete 50 hours of volunteer service. These service hours must be completed within the last five years. Renewal of the ACNP is required every three years. When you renew the credential, you will be required to have completed 30 hours over that three-year period.

0a83bc3d-9167-4155-9c60-9ef15cb2b132.description: Earners of the e-Certificate in Ethical Leadership understand the what, why and how of ethical practice, including the importance of distinguishing personal and organizational perspectives. Earners of this designation are aware of situations and behaviors that put an organization at risk and are capable of leading through a range of ethical dilemmas. They demonstrated competency through assessed coursework.
0a83bc3d-9167-4155-9c60-9ef15cb2b132.name: Ethical Leadership e-Certificate

badge_template_activities.title: Completed required coursework and activities, including review of readings and videos, participation in discussions, and assignment submission.

e2dd99bc-649c-46ef-931b-0ef7d6063399.description: Increase knowledge and skills in empathy-first communications to develop and sustain key relationships.
e2dd99bc-649c-46ef-931b-0ef7d6063399.name: Essential Communication Skills for Nonprofit Leaders e-Certificate

badge_template_activities.title: Participant in discussions and completion of an assessment related to key course topics.

00541cdb-c97e-42d1-b1e5-d0ef639a16f1.description: By completing the three-course certificate, participants have explored and affirmed their individual leadership ideals and developed the skills and confidence to incorporate coaching into their leadership role.
00541cdb-c97e-42d1-b1e5-d0ef639a16f1.name: Coaching as a Leadership Tool

badge_template_activities.title: The Self-Aware Leader: Participants in this course explore their personal values as a leader. The focus is on the “inner” you in leadership, with a focus on self-awareness through multiple leadership assessments and self-reflection.

Build Your Organization’s Bench: Leadership and Coaching Conversations: Participants in this course are introduced to coaching as a leadership tool to build team capacity and increase organizational productivity.

The Capable Coach: Participants in this course will increase their understanding of coaching competencies, including the GROW Model for Coaching, and how to use them productively in team management and development.

e855b1e6-fe80-40d4-ab75-726f40fe97fc.description: By completing the three-course certificate, participants have explored and affirmed their individual leadership ideals and developed the skills and confidence to incorporate coaching into their leadership role. Facilitated by the Fieldstone Leadership Network of San Diego.
e855b1e6-fe80-40d4-ab75-726f40fe97fc.name: Coaching as a Leadership Tool (FLN)

badge_template_activities.title: The Self-Aware Leader: Participants in this course explore their personal values as a leader. The focus is on the “inner” you in leadership, with a focus on self-awareness through multiple leadership assessments and self-reflection. Facilitated by the Fieldstone Leadership Network of San Diego.

Build Your Organization’s Bench: Leadership and Coaching Conversations: Participants in this course are introduced to coaching as a leadership tool to build team capacity and increase organizational productivity. Facilitated by the Fieldstone Leadership Network of San Diego.

The Capable Coach: Participants in this course will increase their understanding of coaching competencies, including the GROW Model for Coaching, and how to use them productively in team management and development. Facilitated by the Fieldstone Leadership Network of San Diego.

462918e2-bf5a-4101-95d3-d7c5f634d469.description: By completing the three-course certificate, participants have enhanced their understanding of equity and bias; created a plan for personal and organizational development around justice, equity, diversity, and inclusion; improved their understanding of social justice; and gained a toolkit of resources to advance social justice in their personal life, their organizations, and their communities.
462918e2-bf5a-4101-95d3-d7c5f634d469.name: Leaders for Equity and Social Justice

badge_template_activities.title: The Equity Journey: Participants in this course explored justice, equity, diversity, inclusion, and bias, gaining awareness of the structural/systemic barriers that hinder equity, In addition, participants created action plans to continue their personal learning about equity and to incorporate equity goals in building their organization effectiveness.

Equity and Nonprofit Organization Success: Participants in this course explored how to build equitable organizations through intentional work in the boardroom, in employee hiring, development, and retention practices, and day-to-day operations with the goal of better quality decisions, a more creative, productive, and focused staff, and enhanced organization outcomes.

What's Fair? Exploring Social Justice in America: Participants in this course explored social justice using a broad lens to improve their understanding of social justice, increase awareness of the barriers that hinder social justice, create a personal definition of social justice and learn how to put it into action, and to examine strategies for supporting and nurturing social justice.

skills.name: Barriers to Equity and Social Justice

e452a806-1f2b-47d3-9cd8-41d9ee00258a.description: Increase understanding of equity and bias, gain awareness of the structural/systemic barriers that hinder equity, and explore strategies for aligning nonprofit practice with social equity objectives.
e452a806-1f2b-47d3-9cd8-41d9ee00258a.name: Leader's Guide to Social Equity e-Certificate

Research shows that CNPs have the critical skills and networks necessary for successful leadership in the nonprofit sector.
82a1e7a9-55ac-4bc8-9ab3-662a5d00289f.name: Certified Nonprofit Professional (CNP) (copy)

badge_template_activities.title: Complete extensive, assessed coursework grounded in the 10 core competencies necessary for effective nonprofit leadership
Complete a minimum of a baccalaureate degree from an accredited institution
Complete a minimum of 300 internship hours at a nonprofit organization or have comparable professional experience
Participate in a nonprofit career conference focused on building networks and social change
Participate in leadership and service activities that prepare candidates for leadership roles
